moves.1. e4 c5: Part of a series of annotated games where I explore the Sveshnikov Sicillian. See my annotated games list for other examples.
moves.2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3: The signature move of the Sveshnikov Sicillian
moves.6. Nxc6: See also http://gameknot.com/annotation.pl/sveshnikov-sicillian-6-nc6?gm=28618 for another example of this line
moves.6... bxc6 7. Bc4 Be7: The other game plays ..d6, which is equally good
moves.8. O-O O-O 9. Be3 Bb7: One of the key differences with the ..Be7 lines. Its a matter of taste. This way black is directly supporting ..d5, and save a tempo over playing ..d6 first
